intro: Gynostemma yixingense var. trichocarpum, commonly known as the Xixing trichocarpum gynostemma, is a rare variant of the gynostemma plant native to China. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and unique fruiting structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into elongated, hairy fruits. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a valuable but endangered species in botanical research.
